attributes.action: propose legislation prohibiting absolutely the use of violence against children by their parents
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The physical punishment of children, including physical punishment administered by their parents, is prohibited in Sweden (1979), Finland (1983), Norway (1987), Austria (1989), Cyprus (1994), Denmark (1997), Latvia (1998), Croatia (1999), Bulgaria (2000), Germany (2000), Israel (2000), Iceland (2003), Pitcairn Islands (2003), Ukraine (2004), Romania (2004), Hungary (2005), and Greece (2006).

In the United Kingdom the Criminal Justice (Scotland) Act (2003), Children Act (2004), and Law Reform (Miscellaneous Provisions) (Northern Ireland) Order (2006) allow parents to use violence against their children by providing, respectively, for "justifiable assault", "reasonable punishment", and a common law defence.

These provisions should be removed from UK law so that nobody is legally permitted to assault a child.
